question_stem: In R, the command set.seed() can be used to initialise the random number generator. Random variables cannot be generated in R without setting the seed.
question_stem_html: In R, the command set.seed() can be used to initialise the random number generator. Random variables cannot be generated in R without setting the seed.

items.part_stem: In R, the command set.seed() can be used to initialise the random number generator. Random variables cannot be generated in R without setting the seed.
items.part_stem_html: In R, the command set.seed() can be used to initialise the random number generator. Random variables cannot be generated in R without setting the seed.
items.solution: Random variables can be generated without setting the seed. However, if we wish to reproduce the stream of random variables, we will have to set the seed first.
items.solution_html: Random variables can be generated without setting the seed. However, if we wish to reproduce the stream of random variables, we will have to set the seed first.
